choices.text:
in javascript how do you save to and read back from localstorage
To save data locally, JavaScript provides the `localStorage` object. This is a part of HTML5's application cache API that allows storing key-value pairs on the client side without any server interaction or database access required for retrieval later in your web browser session only and not across different browsing sessions as cookies are stored per domain name (i.e., website).
To read back data from `localStorage`, you can use JavaScript's string manipulation methods to extract values by key: 
```javascript
let myData = localStorage.getItem('myKey'); // returns null if not found, otherwise the value associated with 'myKey' in current session storage (can be an empty object or array) and assigns it back into a variable for further use; e.g., console logging to show success of retrieval
``` 
You can also set data using `localStorage` by assigning any JavaScript-compatible values as key/value pairs:
